channel.title: Emote tabs
channel.description:
So I'm using the DemolishScape server and the emote tabs have emotes but they don't work. So I'm trying to add the cases myself. I thought that yes would be
case 168: customEmoteID("0855"); // made by Jake } break;
Because 0855 is the Yes emote but I don't know how if customEmoteID is right

item.title: Emote tabs
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

So this is what I have in my client.java

case 185: // clicking most buttons actionButtonId = misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize); if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Jake")) { println_debug("Case 185: " + actionButtonId); } switch (actionButtonId) { case 168: setAnimation(855); // made by Jake break;
Would that work?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 09, 2009, 09:05:35 pm[/size][hr](that's just a sample of the code)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 09, 2009, 09:15:05 pm[/size][hr]Nevermind it didn't work... what would I do?

Read full topic

item.title: Emote tabs
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

r0ckstar96:

Thanks. Also I didn’t need the quotation marks or the 0, but how do I make it so the emote stops and doesn’t just keep repeating itself?

setAnimation();

should work.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

Thanks. Also I didn’t need the quotation marks or the 0, but how do I make it so the emote stops and doesn’t just keep repeating itself?

item.title: Emote tabs
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Get rid of the } in

case 168: startAnimation("0855"); // made by Jake } break;

It is not needed, and it should fix your 100 errors by removing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Emote tabs
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:1, topic:301268”]So I’m using the DemolishScape server and the emote tabs have emotes but they don’t work. So I’m trying to add the cases myself.
I thought that yes would be

[quote] case 168:
customEmoteID(“0855”); // made by Jake
}
break;[/quote]
Because 0855 is the Yes emote but I don’t know how if customEmoteID is right[/quote]

startAnimation();

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

YOu mean something like

if(command[0].equals("emote")) { int emoteID = Integer.parseInt(command[1]); player.doEmote(emoteID); }
